accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Knight Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Knight Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Program Files, Record Group 5, describe the activities of each of the four program areas, Journalism, Education, Arts and Culture and Community Initiatives. They contain the correspondence and subject files of their officers, and documents which trace the origins and progress of the various initiatives which distinguish Knight Foundation in areas such as undergraduate education, the development of community foundations, minority and mid-career journalism education, museum loan networking, literacy, immunization, and the development of symphony orchestras, etc. The Strategic Planning records provide insight into how the Foundation sought to deal with its growth and create a plan for its future. The Foundation's 2000 reorganization resulted in reorganizing the Program areas into the Community Partners Program, the establishment of the National Venture Fund, and the reaffirmation of the Journalism program. Also included are Endowment files from 1987 through 2004.

arrangement.p: This record group is arranged as follows:

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: The finding aid for Sub-group 4: Grant Files can be found in FA1795, FA1783 (A-K), FA1790 (L-Z).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The correspondence in these files is from Cities Program Directors James Spaniolo, and Linda Raybin. It contains information about the grant guidelines for each city from 1992-1995, the grant money available for that city, and the status of that city's grant proposals. The general correspondence begins in 1986, and addresses all communities in general.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The correspondence is arranged alphabetically by the name of the city. General correspondence, sent to all cities, is filed separately. This series is filed chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The manuals contain background on the purpose of the Knight Foundation, the role of Community Advisors, procedures for applying for a grant, policies, program descriptions, and other information to acquaint the advisors with their role in the Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handbook for Community Advisors in Knight Cities. Includes purpose and history of Knight Foundation, board, staff and committees; program descriptions; role of advisors; grant procedures and policies; emergency grants; calendar; communications practices; and operating policies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Revised Handbook for Community Advisors. Includes Description and Purpose of Knight Foundation, Role of Advisors, Grant Procedures, Program Descriptions, Grant Policies, Emergency Grants, Communications Practices, Calendar, Board, Staff, Committees, History, Operating Policies, Donor-advised Funds, Grant History in Miami, Current Grants in Miami.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handbook for Community Advisors in Knight Cities. Includes Description, Purpose and History of Knight Foundation, Board, Staff and Committees, Program Descriptions, Role of Advisors, Grant Procedures, Grant Policies, Emergency Grants, Calendar, Communications Practices, Operating Policies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handbook for Community Advisors in Knight Cities. Includes Description, Purpose and History of Knight Foundation, Board, Staff and Committees, Program Descriptions, Role of Advisors, Grant Procedures, Grant Policies, Emergency Grants, Calendar, Communications Practices, Operating Policies.

did.unittitle: Advisor's Manual - Grand Forks Community Advisory Committee

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handbook for Community Advisors in Grand Forks, ND. Includes membership lists; community investment plan for Grand Forks; table of priorities, outcome, target populations and activities; introductions and general information relating to Knight Foundation, community partners program, community advisory committees, community foundation relationships, Knight Foundation communications, grant histories, and the 2000-2005 strategic plan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains documentation for a Community Advisors meeting, "Sharpen the Focus -- Heighten the Impact," a strategic planning meeting held in 1991 and other meetings in 1994, 1996-1998.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials for Strategic Planning meeting held for Community Advisors to update them on the process and to solicit ideas. Includes miscellaneous memos re: reasons and background info. for meeting, meeting handouts (including strategic planning update, statistical summary, background paper on illiteracy, and biographies of attendees). Addendum 1 contains essay on the "Basic Nature of Foundations," Journalism Program Description, Planning Statement on Education, Arts & Culture Program Description, Wall Street Journal article on Community Development Corporations, and Statement of the Co-Chairs of Knight Foundation Commission on Intercollegiate Athletics. Questions and responses from community advisors follwing the meeting are also included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Advisers meeting materials, includes grant payouts for 1994, community initiatives national grants, youth violence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Advisors meeting materials, includes materials on the strategic plan, grants benefiting communities, youth violence executive summary ("Building Effective Strategies to Address Youth Violence in Your Community"), and guidelines for community needs assessments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Advisors meeting materials, includes agenda, description of strategic grants, sample community needs assessment, update on Youth Violence Initiative, guidelines for the Knight Foundation Donor Advised Funds.

Includes: overview of Knight Foundation's four program areas and their initiatives, a summary of evaluation material about each Knight city required by John Bare, Director of Evaluation, and a list of grant-making strategies for discussion, including case studies.

did.unittitle: Musical Arts Association - The Cleveland Orchestra, 86-142

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Grant 86-142, $250,000.00, to the Blossom Endowment Fund to dedicate and name the Chorus Room at Blossom Music Center "The John S. Knight Room." The Multi-purpose facility provides space where choruses can warm up and rehearse, dining room and gathering place for Orchestra members, performers and production personnel. The patio is used to prepare barbecues for guest performers. When the ballet and opera come to Blossom the room becomes a dressing room with rows of make-up tables. It serves for numerous special events, including annual meetings of the Blossom Women's Committee, and numerous volunteer and donor appreciation events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are two manuals in this subgroup. The Program Policy Manual (1989) outlines the history of Knight Foundation and its programs, and discusses guidelines for the program staff in dealing with grant requests for each program. It includes documents such as the Foundation's Articles of Incorporation, Code of Regulations, Conflict of Interest Policy, Statement of Purpose, and Guidelines from the latest Annual Report, as well as key passages illustrating program policies from Board minutes, committee meeting minutes and memos.

The Program Assistants Manual (1990) outlines the responsibilities of a program assistant, and gives examples of grant write-up, grids, memos to the Distribution Committee, and summaries of proposals. It also contains a list of eligible Knight cities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains history of Knight Foundation (Articles of Incorporation, Code of Regulations, Conflict of Interest Policy, Statement of Purpose, and Guidelines from latest Annual Report). Additional materials excerpted from board minutes, committee meeting minutes, and memos are included on the following subjects: annual support, Arts & Culture, Community Foundations, Deficits and Environmental Emergencies, Education, Endowments, Films, Guidelines, Cities Program Carryover, Health Programs/Hospitals, Individuals and Disqualified Persons, Journalism, Memorials, Minimum Grants, Multi-year grants, Public Broadcasting, Religious Organizations, Tax-Supported Institutions, Trustee Discretionary Grants, United Way.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handbook for program assistants, including responsibilities, and examples of the following: writeup format, green data sheet, index for distribution committee packet, memos to distribution committee, summary of proposals, annual support report, treasurer's grids, staff rejections report, president's cover memo for board packet, distribution committee memo for board packet, Knight Foundation description, associates' grids, philanthropic journals report, Tony Ridder reports, Akron foundations report, proposal stamp, eligible cities, Grants Manager screen printouts, associates' review form, 990 IRS report, Akron foundations group report (rejected and pending proposals), associate grids (following proposal deadline).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The minutes of Program Staff Meetings include discussions about computer systems, procedures and processes in grantmaking, working with community advisors, Gifts for Windows, and other staff issues and concerns.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Memos and agenda for the first program staff retreat. Includes survey of participants and Team reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Agenda for the program leadership meeting, which was designed to increase clarity about the characteristics and attributes of transformational grants.

physdesc.extent: 5 letter document boxes and 1 half-letter box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Museum Loan Initiative formally began in 1993 when Knight Foundation hired Strategic Grantmaker Services to conduct a feasibility study for a museum loan program. In 1994, Knight Foundation teamed with The Pew Charitable Trusts to fund the Museum Loan Program, which was hosted at Massachusetts Institute for Technology, and was officially named the Museum Loan Network in 1995. The records of this initiative include a timeline of program activities 1993-1997, background and planning information, agreements between Knight Foundation and Strategic Grantmaker Services, the feasibility study, meeting minutes and materials, committee lists, program philosophy, and press clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files from inception of Museum Loan Network in 1993 through 1997. Includes: Timeline of Museum Loan Network Activities 1993-1997, Reference Material (Texas Museum Resource Sharing Project), Agreement between Strategic Grantmaker Services and Knight Foundation, Feasabilitity Study by Strategic Grantmaker Services, planning meeting materials, workplan, meeting materials, program coordinator contract description, Advisory Committee meeting minutes, correspondence re: background of program and discussion of potential host institutions, roles and responsibilities for members of network, search criteria for host institutions, Strategic Grantmaker Services progress reports, Advisory Committee List, Press Clippings, Program philosophy, fact sheet and guidelines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sixth financial report covering expenses between October 1, 1996 and August 31, 1998 and a narrative report covering year two (1997-1998) of the grant. Also included is an undated draft of a Museum Loan Network press kit, with background information, press releases, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Application Guidelines and forms; news releases; general brochure; two reports: "Evaluability of the Museum Loan Network: A Preliminary Assessment" by the American Institutes for Research and "Museum Loan Network: Future Sustainability Study" by Museum Management Consultants and a news article re: "Museum Loan Network finds new home at Brown (University, Providence, RI]".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series pertains to the Symphony Initiative. The records contain an agreement with Strategic Grantmaker Services to conduct reviews of proposals from orchestras and develop the program and guidelines (1994), the minutes of a meeting of the Symphony Orchestra Initiative Advisory Committee (1994), and a memo to the Advisory Committee regarding the "Magic of Music" Initiative strategy, schedule and mission statement (1994).

did.unittitle: A Summary of National Initiatives for American Symphony Orchestras

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "A Summary of National Initiatives for American Symphony Orchestras" by John E. Graham. This background paper provides information about important national initiatives by foundations, government, corporations and others to support American symphony orchestras. Also included is a memo from Penny McPhee to Creed Black and Jim Spaniolo re: her ideas on getting the Magic of Music initiative off the ground.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Community Foundations Initiative (Donor-Advised Funds).Broad community needs in Knight cities were the focus of the grants that Knight Foundation awarded to community foundations, which then distributed the funds locally as needed. The files contain correspondence between Knight Foundation, the community foundations, and community advisors. Guidelines, agreements and memos describe the size and scope of the program, and the financial results of investments. Also included is consultant Eugene Struckhoff's report entitled "Knight Foundation and Community Foundations in Knight Cities," dated 1991. More detailed information about this initiative can be found in the grant files for the individual community foundations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Community Foundation files are divided first by year, then alphabetical by city. Folders include correspondence, memos, guidelines and reports relating to donor-advised funds of community foundations. A donor-advised fund is one in which the donor (the Knight Foundation) may make recommendations on how its donated funds are distributed by the Community Foundation which has received them.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Phase I of the National Community Development Initiative (1991) was a collaborative effort among J.P. Morgan, The Prudential, Metropolitan Life Foundation, the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development and seven national foundations (Knight Foundation, Rockefeller Foundation, the John D. and Catharine T. Foundation, Pew Charitable Trusts, Surdna Foundation, Annie E. Casey Foundation, and McKnight Foundation). Its purpose was to fund community development corporations nationwide in order to assist neighborhood renewal in 23 cities. Phase II of the initiative was launched in June 1994 to expand the work of the first phase and further strengthen the designated community foundations across the country. Creed Black was named chairman of the initiative in June 1994.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The files contain memos and correspondence, dating 1993-1995, regarding decisions and actions of NCDI II at meetings, annual meeting books (with budgets, disbursement schedules, work plans, progress reports, and annual reports), legal agreements between funders, approved work plans for individual cities, assessment reports, and conference materials. The press conference briefing materials explain the program and its background.

did.unittitle: Community Indicators Project - Community Survey Reports

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Knight Foundation's Community Indicators Project was undertaken to document the social health of the 26 communities served by the Foundation. The indicators are intended to establish baseline measures of social health that can be used in future years as evaluative benchmarks against which the progress of grantees' programmatic efforts can be measured. The Princeton Survey Research Associates was hired to undertake a survey of the Knight Communities. Each survey is based on telephone interviews of residents who are asked questions relating to citizen engagement, attitudes and behaviors. In addition to information on each of the 26 communities, a national survey was undertaken to provide comparative figures. Information on the project can be found at the beginning of the survey. (4 folders)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Knight Foundation's Community Indicators Project was undertaken to document the social health of the 26 communities served by the Foundation. The indicators are intended to establish baseline measures of social health that can be used in future years as evaluative benchmarks against which the progress of grantees' programmatic efforts can be measured. There is a project report for each of Knight Foundation's 26 communities, plus a national baseline report. Each report consists of a community profile (some have two profiles covering separate geographic areas of the same community); and updates on local issues (community survey and community tab reports). Box 11 contains "Tab Five Appendix: Knight Community Maps" which provides maps of each of the 26 community and indicates where KF is currently making grants, the grantee city, newspaper circulation area and defined granting area.

did.unittitle: Gary, Indiana Focus Group Session on City Problems

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Transcript of a focus group session conducted by Yankelovich Research in Gary, Indiana. According to a note provided by John Bare, Director of Evaluation, the "work ultimately helped us build our advisory committee."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials for a series of community meetings in Gary, IN, including: a report, "Creating Jobs and Alleviating Poverty in Gary, Indiana: An Action Plan"; a proposal for a community development intelligence database for Gary, Indiana; initial reactions to meeting in Gary; and a report (including executive summary) prepared by Jim Johnson, Kenan Institute entitled, "Assessing Community Competitiveness in Gary, Indiana."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials for a series of community meetings in Charlotte, NC, including: worksheets for community outcomes, potential priority outcome indicators report, memo re: results of a demonstration project; community advisors orientation materials, and a community investment plan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials for a series of community meetings in Fort Wayne, including: update on strategic planning, worksheets for community outcomes, advisory committee meeting agenda and reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials for a series of community meetings in Grand Forks, ND, including: a letter outlining Knight Foundation's new approach to local grant making; draft report on "Assessing Community Competitiveness in Grand Forks, ND, by Jim Johnson of the Kenan Institute; and a letter to group of citizens re: invitation to join the community advisory committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Emails and draft descriptions concerning a new program called "Healthy Communities" program and later Community Partners. These exchanges demonstrate how the program was formulated. (Attachments not included.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: John Bare memos to program staff re: 1) describing "risk" in our social investments. Provides a checklist to use to define risk in KF's social investment grants. Includes definitions for idea risk, implementation risk and evidence risk 2)Nov. 13, 2001 community investment plan seminar describing the plan and the seminar and 3) (no date] first draft of Community Investment Plan

did.unittitle: Community Arts and Culture Indicators Initiative: Three City Demonstration Project

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Knight Foundation Community Indicators project was a research-based initiative to learn more about the 26 communities it serves through its grant making. To document changes in the quality of life in its communities, the Foundation established a few key indicators and tracked them over time. The project focused on aspects of community life related to the seven grant-making areas that were the priority of the Community Partners Program. The project folder contains information on three Knight communities: Charlotte, Fort Wayne, and San Jose which made up a pilot group. Results of the demonstration project were shared with participants at a seminar in Ft. Lauderdale in September, 2001. Materials include: meeting agenda, project team, background material, mission and organizational goals, presentations and reports. Also included is a contract proposal for the work by RMC Research and a report by The Urban Institute.

did.unittitle: Community Program Liaison Officer Training Manual

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes sections on: CPP Strategic Update and planning; CAC List; Grants information; orientation; integrating community indicators; community imporovement plans; and National Venture Fund. (2 folders)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Schedule of meetings and events for Community Partners liaison officers who would assemble quarterly at KF headquarters, dubbed "U-Knight".

did.unittitle: A Review of Knight Foundation's September 11th Fund Grant Making

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In response to the attacks of September 11, 2001, KF trustees approved 246 grants totaling $8,306,000 to nonprofit organizations serving Knight's 26 communities. This report summaries the changes affecting these 246 organizations after September 11th, and the impact that the emergency funding had on their ability to deliver goods and services to the communities. Included is a list of all grantees, by community, and amounts granted.

did.unittitle: Geographies of Trust: Examining Variation in Generalized Social Trust Across Knight Communities

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report prepared by Wendy M. Rahn and researchers at the American Institutes for Research, in which Rahn and her associates took one question from the Knight Foundation's Community Indicators Survey asking about trust, and analyzed the level of trust on the community level. One substantial finding found that people with longer commutes to jobs trusted less.

did.unittitle: The Democracy Collaborative: Knight Foundation Civic Engagement Project

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report, "Motivation, Values and Civic Participation" by James Youniss and Daniel Hart explores the connections among motivation, values and engagment in those political processes that preserve and enrich democratic society. (2 folders)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A plan was done for each KF community and was a collaborative effort between the community program officer and the content program officers. Topics address include community funding priorities, children's health funding, community mobilizing funding priorities, funding guidelines and a community advisory roster. 3 folders.

did.unittitle: Community Program Liaison Officer Training Manual

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes sections on: Strategic plan; community investment plan; grants; budgets; and reference.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four cluster evaluations in areas where the Community Partners Program has been focused, 2001-2005: Early Childhood, Youth Development, Economic Development and Earned Income Tax Credit. The evaluations categorized the grants across communities into common goals and strategies, synthesize lessons learned from evaluation activities and provide a framework for grantees, KF staff and trustees to learn about promising practices within program areas. The four evaluations combined examined 230 grants in the amount of $72.5 million made since 2001.

did.unittitle: School Readiness Connections: Conference Guide for Knight Community Participants

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The guide was for community educators of the Knight Foundation funded School Readiness Connections project. The educators attended special programs and events at the National Association for the Education of Young Children conference in Washington, DC.

did.unittitle: Lessons Learned from the Creation of a Multi-Tenant Nonprofit Center in Charlotte, NC

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report prepared by Peggy Eagan, Executive Director of the Children & Family Services Center of Charlotte for the Knight Foundation. Includes an executive summary, history of the Charlotte project, and lessons learned. The purpose of a Multi-Tenant Nonprofit Center is to provide a community with a visible location to house several nonprofit entitites.

did.unittitle: Starting Out Right: Cluster Evaluation of the Early Childhood Grants

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Year 2 and Year 3 Final Reports and Executive Summary prepared by Lisa Klein and Deanna Gomby is a review of the more than 125 grants focusing on early childhood issues awarded by KF.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "A Tale of Two Cities" brochure produced by the Philadelphia Investment Board, and sponsored by KF, describes a city with extremes from an education and workforce development perspective.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Information on the Akron Biomedical Corridor, a significant KF project, consists of a project overview and statement of principles and intent (1/17/2008); a presentation document on the Akron Academic Health Center (as the project is now known) dated 1/25/2008, along with a meeting list and participant information and briefing report; and an update document prepared by Booz Allen Hamilton.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Agenda; executive summary: research findings and design principles; participant biographies and participating organizations. The pilot communities were Detroit and Philadelphia. Also included are interviews of 20 black men from Detroit and Philadelphia briefly describing their projects (2 DVDs).

Evaluation of a series of grants to this organization, which totalled $ 3.6 million over seven years. Includes background of the grant, and lessons learned.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Presidential Leadership Grant Program, 1989-1993, provided ten discretionary grants of $100,000 each to small, tuition-dependent colleges serving special populations (such as women and minorities). The use of the funds was left to the discretion of the president of each college.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These files date from 1989 to 1993. They contain background and planning materials, rankings of the proposed recipients and recommendations, an overview of this phase of the program, including use of the grants by the recipients, and materials from a meeting of the college presidents who received the grants.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records of Education program to reward outstanding leadership of selected college presidents with unrestricted grants. Phase I of the program took place in 1990/91. Records include correspondence re: background and planning of the program, 1990 and 1991 rankings and recommendations for grant awardees (including writeups of each grant), and an overview of the program (use of grants by recipients) and its progress, 1990-1993.

did.unittitle: Presidential Leadership Grant Program, Phase II

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records of Education program to reward outstanding leadership of selected college presidents with unrestricted grants. Phase II of the program took place from 1996 to 1999. Records include correspondence re: background and planning of the program, rankings and recommendations for grant awardees (including writeups of each grant), and meeting schedules and participant lists.

did.unittitle: Evaluation for Knight Foundation by Mary Maples Dunn

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Evaluation took into account how the grants were used, the college and community response to the grants, and their effectiveness. The evaluation was based largely on conversations that Dunn had with the college presidents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains files related to the Knight Foundation's early interest and activities in literacy. It includes the files of Sarah Wright from 1987 to 1990, when she headed the Foundation's Education efforts in Akron. Among the literacy files are responses to a 1987 letter from Rolfe Neill to publishers in Knight-Ridder cities (now considered community advisers) asking them to identify opportunities for literacy funding in their communities. This file, titled "Knight-Ridder Newspaper Involvement Questionnaire," is significant to the Foundation's efforts in the field of literacy because it is cited by president Creed Black as "one of the more effective early efforts by Knight Foundation to target funding and utilize the network of community advisers to be proactive in identifying good funding opportunities."

Other files included are a summary of Knight Foundation literacy projects 1985-1986, correspondence regarding the formation and activities of the Literacy Task Force for the North American Newspaper Industry (Creed Black was a member of this task force when it operated in 1988-1989), a brochure on the Kenan Family Trust Literacy Project (related to the Foundation's eventual major funding of the National Center for Family Literacy), and other correspondence on Knight Foundation literacy efforts.

There is one file that contains a memo by Education Program Director A. Richardson Love, titled "Education Program Evaluation Activity." It gives an overview and history of Knight Foundation's activities and initiatives in the Education Program from 1989 to 1997.

did.unittitle: Education Program Evaluation Activity and Overviews, 1988-1998

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Education Program Evaluation Activity," a history and overview of the activities and initiatives of the Education Program, written by A. Richardson Love, Knight Foundation Education Program Director. Discusses Excellence in Undergraduate Education 1989-1994, Presidential Leadership Grant Program 1990-91 and 1996-, Excellence in Education Program 1992-, Large Scale Reform Initiative 1994-, Dade Public Schools South Pointe Elementary Teacher Associate Program 1991-1995, New American Schools, Galef Institute/Kentucky Collaborative for Teaching and Learning and Different Ways of Knowing, Teach for America, the John S. Knight Writing Program at Cornell University, American Academy for Liberal Education, the Knight Higher Education Collaborative and Institute for Research on Higher Education at the University of Pennsylvania, Communities in Schools, Florida International University, and an overview of Knight Foundation's support for literacy. Also included are: The Education Advisory Committee: A Changing Role (1988-1998); Education Program Update, 1992-June 1995; and Overview: Knight Foundation Support for Education.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The files of the Journalism Advisory Committee contain meeting notes, minutes and preparatory materials; correspondence on the First Amendment Subcommittee; correspondence regarding proposals for journalism-related grants; discussions of the proposals for Knight Chairs in Journalism and that selection process; an annual report from the schools where Knight Chairs are located (1996); and correspondence regarding the types of programs that the Journalism program might fund. There are also materials on the selection of new members for the advisory committee, a membership and term list (1994), and a file on the appointment of a Journalism Program Officer, Del Brinkman (1993).
For more records on the Journalism Advisory Committee, SEE ALSO Record Group 3, Lee Hills Papers, Journalism Advisory Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The files include an undated description of the Journalism Program's goals and grant priorities, a record of the program grants made from 1975 to 1992, information about the First Amendment issue (1986, 1991), a report, dated 1986, by Philip Meyer on major journalism grants in the United States, a report on the Knight Science Journalism Fellowships at MIT (1992), journalist education (1993), Knight Foundation's interest in attaining a free press in Eastern Europe (1993), and the Newspaper Association of America Foundation's meeting of newspaper-related foundations (1993, 1994).

The series includes files kept by Del Brinkman, Journalism Program Director. His files contain notes for a statement on the education of journalists for the 21st century, and journalism education in general. A report, dated 1995, by the Institute for Journalism Excellence, which was funded by Knight Foundation, can also be found in this series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four lists, arranged alphabetically by grantee, of grants made by the Knight Foundation in journalism. The first list covers the years 1975 through March, 1986. There are three additional lists covering grants made during the years 1990, 1991 and 1992.

bioghist.p: The International Press Fellowship Program was initiated in 1993 for the purpose of sending American journalism professionals overseas on training and consulting missions.

Knight Journalism Chairs include files on Knight Chairs at Stanford University, the University of Miami, and the University of Kansas, including correspondence on the search for a new director for the John S. Knight Fellowship program at Stanford University (1989); the goals and budget of the Stanford Program (1991); a curriculum vitae for the Knight chair holder at the University of Miami, Robert Kolb (1991); and correspondence regarding the Knight Chair at the University of Kansas (1992). There are also rankings of new chair proposals by school and the selection process (1991-1995); a report on the standards and practices of endowed chairs (1990); the philosophy and priorities of Knight Chairs (1992); and correspondence regarding the possibility of a First Amendment Chair at a law school (1994).
For more files on the Knight Chairs, SEE Record Group 3, Lee Hills Papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: News@Knight article and transcript re: Knight Chairs Rountable discussion at the Poynter Institute, St. Petersburg, Florida, November 6, 2004. Participants were asked to discuss the major issues facing journalism today. The discussion was lead by Keith Woods, Poynter Institute dean. Subjects included media concentraiton, changing newsroom attitudes, transparency in journalism, a skeptical public, the impact of cable TV news, the rise of Internet bloggers, scandals at major newspapers and the quest for truth in news coverage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fellowships and professional development for experienced journalists are the focus of this Mid-Career Journalism program. The files include descriptions of mid-career journalism fellowships and professional development programs funded by the Knight Foundation at Columbia University, the University of Maryland, Stanford University, Yale University, the University of Michigan, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Northwestern University and Harvard University (not dated). There is a status report to the Board of Trustees on the mid-career programs at the above universities (1989); a survey of mid-career journalism fellowships by Jerome Aumente (funded by Knight Foundation, 1989); and various correspondence, lists of fellows and reports from the mid-career programs at the University of Maryland (1990-1994); the University of Michigan (not dated); Massachusetts Institute of Technology (1987-1994); and Columbia University (1990-1995). Also included are a list of directors, 1995, and a study re: a conceptual approach to mid-career training, 2003.

Knight Fellowships for Professional Journalists), Yale University (Knight Foundation Fellowship in Law for Journalists Program), University of Michigan (Knight Journalism Fellowships in Business, Medicine, Law and Education), MIT (Knight Science Journalism Fellowships), Northwestern University (Newspaper Management Center), and Harvard University (Nieman Fellowships).

scopecontent.p: "Conceptual Approach to Midcareer Training" by Lee B. Becker and Tudor Vlad, University of Georgia, was prepared for the Knight Foundation. The paper postulates that the definition of the midcareer has changed for some industry segments and that a one-size-fits-all approach to midcareer training will have limitations. The possible role of the Knight Foundation in a more modern society is discussed.

This was a 1995 project of the American Society of Newspaper Editors (ASNE), supported by Knight Foundation, which sought to study and clarify journalists' values and connect them with the public in new ways. did.unittitle: Reports re: Evaluation Support to Knight Foundation Grantees, September - December 2005

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These two reports, Summary and Executive, were prepared by David Fetterman, of Fetterman & Associates, who also did the work. Dr. Fetterman provided selected grantees with evaluation consultation services. The services ranged from helping grantees think about the logic of evaluation as it relates to program accountability and improvement to the actual deployment of online surveys to solicit information and insights used to inform program decision-making. Eric Newton and Donovan Lee-Sin chose the sample from mid-career program candidates.

did.unittitle: Gallup Report: Soul of the Community, Narrative

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The goal of the Knight Foundation-Gallup Soul of the Community project was to measure citizens' engagement in each of the 26 KF communities in which they live. These reports add to the ongoing community narrative by showing how the citizens of the community feel about the place they live, what it has to offer them, and what they offer back to it. The data from this project are intended to be used to track the engagement of the community over time and to identify key strengths and opportunities for the communities. There is a narrative report for each community. 2 folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A reporter analysis by Tony Mecia. Mr. Mecia was hired by Knight Foundation to prepare an analysis on the effectiveness of the American Dream Fund, whose purpose was to fund a wide array of local, grassroots nonprofits in Knight communities. This report includes a document review and interview with nearly 20 people involved in all facets of the American Dream Fund.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These files contain strategic planning materials for the Foundation in general (1991-1992), the Education Program (1995), and the Journalism Program (1995). Five folders relate to a "Planning Activities and Background: 1950-1990" report, including "Strategic PlanPhases I and II (1981-1982) with background on planning for the bequest from J.S. Knight, the John S. Knight Fellowship at Stanford, and planning for the future. There is also "Sharpen the Focus -- Heighten the Impact" plan (1992), which discusses priorities and plans for all four program areas, and has a ten-year financial plan. The "Strategic Planning Review" folder (1995) contains the goals, objectives and strategies for all programs, as well as additional material relating to planning for the Education Program. This review was facilitated by Nancy Raybin of Arthur Raybin and Associates. The "Journalism Program Update" folder holds the results of the strategic planning efforts for that program in 1992, and its progress to June 1995. Also included are a Knight Foundation Strategic Plan Goals and Objectives (1997); two copies of a Strategic Plan/Situational Analysis prepared by The Conservation Company in 2000; Community Relationships Task Force meeting materials (2000-2001) and a Strategic Planning Report, prepared by TCC and background readings (2005).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A report on KF's strategic planning activities and the policy decisions growing out of those effort. Report consists of decade by decade overview; copies of correspondence from John S. Knight, Lee Hills, comments from James L. Knight concerning his brother's estate, minutes of board meetings pertaining to the reorganization study committee, etc. Five folders, including "Strategic Plan--Phase I" (1981, defining major issues confronting KF); "Strategic Plan--Phase II" (1-3/1982, fact finding phase re. meetings with other foundations, JSK estate, diversification issues, etc.); "Strategic Plan--Phase IIB" (6/24/1982, progress report prepared for Board meeting re. dispositon of JSK bequest, planning for the future); "Strategic Plan--Phase IIB" (12/15/1982, progress report prepared for Board meeting re. visitis to other foundations, Knight Fellowship at Stanford, etc.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Strategic Planning meeting materials in preparation for the strategic planning retreat/special meeting of members, and quarterly meeting of trustees, held on 6/20/91 in the Sonesta Beach Hotel on Key Biscayne, FL. Topics included discussion on the search for new trustees, governance of the foundation, and the strategic planning retreat to be held on 6/21/91 and 6/22/91.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Schedule and meeting materials for the strategic planning retreat, titled "Sharpen the Focus-Heighten the Impact." 2 copies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Strategic Planning Meeting #2 and #3, "Sharpen the Focus-Heighten the Impact" meeting materials. 2 folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Review of program goals, objectives and strategies, including additional information related to planning for the Education program. Also included are remarks by Lee Hills, and Creed Black; a background memo by Jim Spaniolo, a statement of purpose; financial and grant payout projections; program strategies; grantmaking and program updates, 1992-1995. Review was facilitated by Nancy Raybin, consultant.

did.unittitle: Strategic Plan: Sharpen the Focus--Heighten the Impact

Includes priorities and plans for Community Initiatives, Journalism, Education, Arts & Culture, Financial Plan (10-year financial projection, historical data), planning for the organization and operations (future staffing needs, advisory committees, role and responsibility of advisors, future trustee meetings, the grant making process, and communications plan and evaluation).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Results of Strategic Planning for Journalism Program in 1992, and progress to 6/95. Includes notes by Del Brinkman, Journalism Program Director.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Provides goals and objectives and strategies for managing external and internal communications and acting as communications resources.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Proposals for several consulting groups who responded to a request for proposals to assist the Knight Foundation with an organizational strategic planning effort.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Folder one contains the executive summary, an organizational assessment, and an environmental and external analysis. Folder two contains appendices consisting of benchmarking analyses of 37 other foundations. Folder three consists of supplemental materials, including a statement of purpose, vision statements, retrospectives views of program areas and evaluation issues.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report, dated September 2000, prepared by The Conservation Company. There are three folders. Folder one contains the executive summary, an organizational assessment, and an environmental and external analysis. Folder two contains appendices consisting of benchmarking analyses of 37 other foundations. Folder three consists of supplemental materials, including a statement of purpose, vision statements, retrospectives views of program areas and evaluation issues. NOTE: This is copy 2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This summary report, prepared by William M. Mercer, Incorporated, provides a summary of the Knight Foundation staff retreat focused on Strategic Plan implementation. Includes retreat objectives, implementation questions/concerns, group exercises and discussions. Includes a powerpoint copy of The Conservation Company's situational analysis and other hand-outs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Community Foundation Relationships Task Force was created, as part of the Knight Foundation strategic planning effort, to assist with strategic plan implementation activities. The Community Foundation Relationships Task Force was charged with reviewing and recommending criteria that can be used in evaluating the financial performance of community foundations and making recommendations for the viability of increasing the donor advised funds in the exisiting communities. Materials include memos, work plans, meeting minutes and agendas, notes, and draft manual. Also included is back-up information on community foundations and materials from The Conservation Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Presentation re: evaluation process at KF.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Background materials compiled for the 2005 Strategic Planning process. The notebook is divided into the following sections: 2000-2005 Strategic Plan; Logistics & Timelines; Final Principles; Post 9/2004; 2003 Midpoint Review; Final Principles, Pre 9/2004; Community Partners; Defining Success; 1999-2000 Planning Process; and Articles of Interest. Included are memos, TCC reports, emails, and presentations. (2 folders)

did.unittitle: Strategic Planning Process: Staff Notes and TCC Group Reports

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The reports are for the following groups: Communications, Community Partners, Evaluation, Internal Operations, Journalism and National Venture Fund. Includes memos, graphs, presentations, emails, and surveys. (2 folders)

did.unittitle: Background Materials re: Strategic Planning Revision

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Memos, meeting notes (prepared by Belinda Lawrence), presentation materials, emails, and reports all helping to focus on revisions to the 2001 strategic plan. Many of the materials were prepared by TCC as they researched and interviewed for their evaluation reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series of memos prepared by Mike Maidenberg re: strategic plan revision planned for 2005. The memos include background readings and remarks intended to broaden perspective, stir thinking and deepen discussion of Knight Foundation's future.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents include information on a KF Due Diligence Policy; bringing the Letter of Inquiry process online; an update on process improvement; transformational grantmaking; integration of new business processes into work flow; notes from a Blue Sky meeting; Board Grants Strategic Review; and grants management process and software review.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Document (prepared by Administration) requesting preparation of strategic planning reports by departments in order to improve the allocation of resources, strategic alignment and communication between departments. Includes an example on how to prepare the report.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Knight Foundation: Operational Assessment: meeting schedule, attendees, kick-off, summary of findings and preliminary recommendations for the strategic planning group tasked with discovery and analysis of KF's grant making processes and systems. Cliff Consulting facilitated the meetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chart of transformation ideas in the pipeline for Journalism and Communities programs; flow chart of Media Innovation Initiatives; memo from Juan Martinez to the Executive Committee requesting information on initiatives for September 18, 2008 meeting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a memo from Alberto Ibarguen to KF staff explaining the launch of a new strategic initiative with the help of a Trustee Strategic sub-committee and McKinsey & Co. Timeline is for November 2008 - February 2009. Assisting Alberto will be Paula Ellis. Also included are copies of all working documents prepared by McKinsey, including a working draft of the Board of Trustees presentation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Staff memos from Sam Gill re: scenario planning. This process involved all staff in weekly planning meetings, starting in January 2016. The goal for the process is to explore whether KF's basic assumptions make sense across the range of possible futures for the organization. One meeting featured a special guest, Danny Franklin, a pollster, who spoke on key trends in American politics. Also included is a February 2016 research report, "Informed & Engaged in 2026: Scenarios" prepared by DSI, Decision Strategies International (and a revised version of the Scenarios distributed to staff in June 2016). Also included are a draft, dated June 2016 and the final version, dated September 2016, of the KF Strategic Plan; memos to staff from Alberto Ibarguen and Sam Gill, and comments from several KF trustees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents (prepared by FSG Social Impact Advisors consulting group) provide an overview of strategy for KF's future work on community engagement and includes "areas of consensus and outstanding questions". Includes a summary of expert external expert research, an assessment of St. Paul, MN's community engagement, engagement grantmaking, and values conversation, and a Powerpoint presentation re: National Foundations and Community Engagement. FSG (Foundation Strategy Group).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: KF Statement of Strategy published in December 2016 lists the three core beliefs of the foundation to promote excellence in journalism and the success of the communities in which the Knight brothers worked. Includes social investment principles and grant-making programs. Also includes an introductory memo to staff/trustees from Alberto Ibarguen and a comment from trustee Stephanie Bell-Rose. Also, draft of KF strategy plan.

did.unittitle: Gaining Ground: How nonprofit news ventures seek sustainability

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

A Pilot Study to Determine who Casts Ballots - and Who Doesn't - in 4 U.S. Cities: Charlotte, Detroit, Portland and St. Paul" and "Why Millennials Don't Vote For Mayor: Barriers and Motivators for Local Voting". The information was gathered by Lake Research Partners

did.unittitle: Viewing The Future: Virtual reality in Journalism

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Viewing The Future: Virtual reality in Journalism. Journalism underwent a flurry of virtual reality content, creation, production and distribution starting in the final months of 2015. Key findings: The state of virtual reality in journalism today.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Giving Day Initiative Summary Report. KF launched a pilot program in 2012 to determine whether giving days would be an effective way for community foundations to experiment with technologies like online fundraising and social media. What began as a small pilot program evolved into a multi-faceted Giving Day Initiative, through which KF supported eighteen giving day organizers to run 25 giving days (draft report). Also included are notes on the Giving Day Initiative.

did.unittitle: Lessons From the Early Years of Mission-Related Investing at Knight Foundation

did.unittitle: Mobile-First News: How people use smartphones to access information

scopecontent.p: Mobile-First News: How people use smartphones to access information. This is a two-part series, excerpted from a custom research study conducted with Nielsen and commissioned by KF, delves first into several key findings, and then dives into how specific groups of people use different mobile platforms for news, May 2016.

did.unittitle: Beyond the dollars: The long-term value of giving days for community foundations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Beyond the dollars: The long-term value of giving days for community foundations. KF launched a pilot program in 2012 to determine whether giving days would be an effective way for community foundations to experiment with technologies like online fundraising and social media. This evaluation brought to light the numerous ways in which giving days provided long-term value to the community foundations that hosted them.

did.unittitle: The Role of Human Relationship In Moving People to Action: The Messenger and the Medium Matter

A study conducted by 270 Strategies to show that people are more likely to respond to and engage with personalized content. They took this question of mobile messaging preferences to a community level.

did.unittitle: Mobile News Notifications: A two-wave experiment with smartphone users

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mobile News Notifications: A two-wave experiment with smartphone users. A study by the Engaging News Project at the University of Texas at Austin, examines the benefits of mobile push notifications to both drive traffic to journalistic content, and to inform the public.

did.unittitle: Catalyzing Connections: The State of Miami's Startupt Ecosystem

Engine Research Foundation compiled the findings in this report by analyzing secondary data sources and conducting individual interviews and surveys with grantees and other interested parties from the Miami community, March 22, 2016.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From Airwaves to Earbuds. Lessons from Knight Investments in digital audio and podcasting. Podcasting and on-demand audio is a rapidly evolving medium, ripe for experimentation and innovation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Knight commissioned an evaluation intended to assess both achievements and lessons to date and provide a framework for measuring network-related activities going forward. Key areas of inquiry included: Fellowship outcomes, Newsroom impact, Network effect. The evaluation was conducted from January 2016 to September 2016.

did.unittitle: Changing Gears In the Motor City

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Changing Gears In the Motor City: A Financial and Social Impact Assessment of the Detroit Development. This review examines the financial impact of the conversion to a grant in August 2015, as well as the Detroit Development Fund's broader social outcomes. Key Findings: Positive economic impact, Improved Financial Stability, Heightened Prospects for growth and gains in diversity with room for improvement.

did.unittitle: Full Learning and Impact Research and Assessment Reports

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An assessment of Knight Foundation's Local Media Initiative. KF commissioned Tim Griggs, a digital media consultant and former publisher of The Texas Tribune, to study the Local Media Initiative and decipher the status of local news organizations funded and broader lessons. The study examined grantee successes and challenges, promising models, critical needs across the local media space and ways that Knight and other funders could address those needs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Grant 2013-45680, The Department of Better Technology, LLC, $460,000. Without open, easy procurement government will consistently pay too much for the development and implementation of yesterday's technology. Because of this, returns on investment for open government are difficult to prove to the taxpayer. Procure.io is a proven system that makes procurement simpler and increases government's access to tech, driving down the cost of transparency and engagement.
